fields.summary: Stopped BFEBS instance destroyed when upgrading

fields.description:
When using BFEBS instances - if a cloud admin wants to upgrade Eucalyptus, using euca-stop-instances with BFEBS instances to stop them, then upgrade the cloud causes data loss.  

At this moment upgrade from 3.0.2 to 3.1.2 needs to terminate all the instances. But the cloud admin does not want to lose data. Also, deleteOnTerminate flag wasn't followed on 3.0.2, impacting the integrity of the data on upgrade.

comments.body: Moved to confirm to be reviewed by Engineering.

I know we've discussed this before, but deleteOnTerminate working incorrectly was an advantage :)
It wasn't honored, so we wouldn't deleteOnTerminate even if requested.

Talked about this in the bug scrub: talked with [~viglesias] in order to reproduce this problem.

Steps to be taken:
- understand if the 3.0 database has set or not set the DeleteOnTerminate flags (there was an issue in 3.0 about this flag
- create a 3.0.2 install, add a bfEBS instance and replicate with and without the DeleteOnTerminate flag
- iterate with [~viglesias] to see if some workaround is possible

I will take the bug for now while we are working to replicate the issue.

Got some attempt to reproduce the issue in our lab: 
- got a 3.0.2 install 
- started 3 instances (bfEBS) with a mix of DeleteOnTerminate flag on and off
- confirmed that the database had the flag only set as true no matter what
- tried to upgrade to 3.1.2 and got an error (I will paste it at the end of the comment)
- the new DB is squeaky cleaned, not even the old admin creds are working, and of course no trace of the old instances (volumes are still there).

[root@g-15-11 yum.repos.d]#

[~kedwards] told me on IRC that this may be an old cache in /var/run/eucalyptus which was a consequence of the first upgrade that failed because I was missing a pkg (the san-libs bit): repeated the upgrade after cleaning the cache in /var/run/eucalyptus and the upgrade succeeded. The instance are not there and they are not in the database. Volumes backing the instances are still around.

So, after the upgrade, I tried to take a snapshot of the volume, register it, and then run an instance from it. The instance booted, eucalyptus believes it runs, libvirt has it, but there seems to be some corruption, since the console shows only something that looks like the initial grub menu, but nothing after that.

I took a look at the volume, and the volume contains a linux disk. I mounted the root file system, and I could find the linux installation there, so, albeit all the parts seems to be there, we cannot boot it at this time.
changed affects version to reflect where code must be fixed.

Since this was a problem with the 3.0->3.1 upgrade, there is no change needed to accommodate 3.2.1.

The test process for this fix is:

* set up a 3.0 cloud
* register a BFEBS image
* launch two instances of it
* stop the instances
* upgrade to 3.1
* try to start one of the instances again.  Leave the other one stopped.
* ensure that the instance is accessible
* stop the running instance again.
* upgrade to 3.2
* start the instances
* ensure both instances are accessible
Putting this in QA state, because my work is done.  I'm not sure what's still needed here, since we have no intent to release a 3.1.3, which would be the only useful place for this fix to land.
We did upgraded one customer from 3.0.2, to 3.1.2 and finally to 3.2.1 with stopped instances. The DB upgrade was successful.

Reproducible when going 3.1.2 -> 3.2.2

I had 1 BFEBS stopped before upgrading.  After upgrade no instances shown and describe volumes is sad.

{code}

mistakenly resolved. [~viglesias] made me do it :)
